title: ISic000670. I.Sicily inscription 000670
body:
Facsimile Images

Cerriniae ·
L(uci) · f(iliae) · Cottiae
Cottia · Euphrosyne
filiae piissimae
5s(ua) · p(ecunia) · p(osuit) · l(oco) · d(ato) · d(ecreto) · d(ecurionum) ·
[et ob] dedicationem earum
[den]arios · divisit

Apparatus criticus

Text of Bitto 2001

English translation

Cottia Euphrosyne set this (statue) up out of her own money for Cerrinia Cottia, daughter of Lucius, a very dutiful daughter, in the place determined by the decuriones. She distributed denarii in return for the dedication of these (statues).

commentary
